website_summaries.verdict: They're fairly pricey, but the combination of very good sound and a sleek, comfortable design, make the KEF M500s contenders in the $300 price class.
pros: The KEF M500 on-ear headphones are sleekly and sturdily designed and offer a very comfortable fit
They also sound very good and come with two detachable cords, one of which has an Apple-friendly inline remote/microphone for smartphone use
The headphones fold up and fit into an attractive protective carrying case
cons: some people may not find the sound detailed enough

website_summaries.verdict: KEF's M500 headphones deliver rich, clean audio, plenty of features, and a comfortable on-ear fit, making them worth the high price.
pros: Solid audio performance with rich lows, clean mids and highs
Inline remote and microphone for mobile devices
cons: Doesn't block out room noise very well, making it hard to use in noisier environments, like airplanes

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at full RRP
customer_reviews.text: These are very good if you can get them under £100, but for the current price of £129 they are not worth it. They'd make a good set of travel headphones, but they do leak sound and placement is quite frustrating. Bass is fairly shallow and the overall tone is quite warm. Detail is there but not over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Straz

customer_reviews.title: It drove me mad!
customer_reviews.text: Warning: once you put those cans on, you won't be able to enjoy your music with anything less or cheaper. It will bleed your wallet dry; you would want to buy a good DAC to go with it, and you will then want to spent 600+ pounds to buy a set of KEF desk speakers to satisfy your newly found ever growing desire for better sound quality. It's that good! You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Yue

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, but not for long sessions.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, comfort and build. I love these headphones so much. I wish I could have kept them. Being over the ear headphones, they bend my ears back and after an hour or two, my ears start to hurt. Other than that, they are so lovely to wear. Perhaps if I had a smaller head they wouldn't have ended up hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Returned as faulty and incorrect colour
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Headphone jack faulty and for some reason the ear covers were brown... Couldn't find brown version anywhere on KEF website so slightly suspicious that these were fake.
customer_reviews.author: samtuk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful & Gorgeous. Lovely designed & Well-Finished. Sound like Heaven
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but useless due to poor isolation
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, but very poor sound isolation, both of the outside world (making it hard to hear the music) and of the music, meaning you annoy everyone sitting next to you. Sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: RibRob

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable, however any major sudden movements will dislodge these ...
customer_reviews.text: Very, very well-rounded headphones sound-wise. Very strong bass, toned mids and the highs never overwhelm or tax your listening over long periods. Build quality is solid, however I don't believe I've owned these long enough to really comment on build quality. No problems yet. The fit is very, very comfortable, however any major sudden movements will dislodge these from your head. I didn't think that these would isolate a lot of sound since these are over-ears but they really do do a solid job. I overall thoroughly enjoy these. 9/10, round it up to 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vecchione

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones with not so awesome aux cord.
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. Sound quality is great, they are comfortable, great bass without it overwhelming the other parts, and durable. Now for the aux cord. It looks nice. Unfortunately it doesn't work well. My audio will randomly fade from normal to really quiet then to really loud. Also the mic/control box on the cord only works with apple products. Overall I am a satisfactied customer though.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Embrey

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, I've had them for almost two years. There is something about the sound that is so satisfying... I can't quite explain it. I pair it with my microstreamer DAC and it sounds fantastic. The only con I have is the leather stitching is starting to come apart after a year and a half... I will need to send them in for warranty service as the right ear is almost all pad with no leather!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Divine sound & comfort
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance & ordered these headphones without having tried them on or even with significant reviewer advice. I LOVE them! They are beautiful, comfortable, and most importantly the sound kicks a$$!!! Gorgeous bass, clear high tones... Amazing. The headphones & accompanying parts are clearly high quality. Hard to imagine anyone being disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hartwig

customer_reviews.title: Happy Ears
customer_reviews.text: I did a fair bit of research into On-Ear Headphones that suite my overall purposes of sound quality and mobility. These headphones hit the mark exactly with both counts. The reviews I read indicated a fit that would in a short period of time cause discomfort, this caused some concern since I have a big head .... I say these are well balanced in fit and the adjustment is easy enough for my size 7 3/4 head. The sound quality is what really makes these so nice, well suited for my purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Larin D. Felker

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it. Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Theres not much to say other than when listening to music with these cans I get the chills. The tight bass and the mids and highs all form something aurally beautiful. I have a bose system in my vehicle that sounds great, but it over emphasizes on the highs and mids, I guess you could say its a little bright. Up until I heard music through these I thought my car stereo was an audiophile experience...while its close due to shear loudness and rumble from speakers it can't match the natural clarity that the M500's produce. Its unreal to say the least. Great purchase and can't give these enough props.
customer_reviews.author: jme2712

customer_reviews.title: Buy these 'phones.
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I have ever used. Great frequency response, marvelous spatial presentation. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill  Feldman

customer_reviews.title: can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Don't plan on going jogging with these cans. Great portability, sound, and comfort. Fold up well in a hard shell case, noise isolation is excellent. Kudos Kef.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel O. Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest transparent sound ever.
customer_reviews.text: Last abojt a year in heavy use before pads start to tear and wear out .Buying third pair. You can get replacements if you want..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lord!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I have ever heard in the 300 dollar range .Very natural sound.They do not color the sound like some other manufacturers. Very light and comfortable. I don't get the one complaint about hurting ears after long usage as they are the lightest pair in this price range I have ever put on my head. I considered the B&w P5's but I have a pair of in ear C5's(which i like very much) from them and they are a little bass heavy . You will not go wrong with this pair .Enjoy.I know you will.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're comfortable with on-ear phones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, relatively balanced from low to mids to high. Looks good, solid build quality. But the on-ear pads irritated my ears after about 30 minutes of use so I had to keep taking them off. I hope they come out with a set of over-ears.
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Paul

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, USED. There was no indication whether it was open box or demo or what. So initially I was a bit worried. When it arrived, right on time, I could not see any indication of the package ever being opened. Usually when people tear off the secure tape it will tear the cardboard a little. Also it was perfectly secure inside the box. In other words, this is a brand new product for a used price. I saved $$. Thanks 1OneCall... Forgot to mention, They sound great. In my opinion, better than the highly rated PSB.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing performance. You can plug it into any devices ...
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing performance. You can plug it into any devices and it will give you back a great performance of the music.
customer_reviews.author: Qianli Wang

customer_reviews.title: Like Being There!
customer_reviews.text: Very natural, balanced, uncolored reproduction, and comfortable to wear for hours.
customer_reviews.author: CRT

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing gear!
customer_reviews.text: Sound preferences can be different personally, but I thinks this one is close to universial. I bought this headphone for iphone and also indoor sound monotoring for electric guitar amp. Exteamly well-balanced sound, and especially bass tone is not so scattered but higly condensated. The feeling on my ears is so soft when I'm wearing it. Looks quite luxury and clean. I recommand this gear for metal, rock, jazz and house music lovers too even though it depends on eq system.
customer_reviews.author: JS Song

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: YES! VERY clean sound. truly sound isolating. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sumpter

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones to own and enjoy at this price range.  Try them!
customer_reviews.text: KEF knows sound. Their 1050 speakers are an audiophile bargain, per Stereophile magazine. (I own them also). These are just as good, but also beautifully made, won't break, and are light and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: robwi

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced; quality materials; excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear. Quality workmanship. Sound is superbly balanced with a slight emphasis on bass. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MacBooboo

customer_reviews.title: These things kick ears!
customer_reviews.text: These things kick ears! Not only is the design uber-cool but quite functional. The burn-in continues but the sweet sound is already present. Surprisingly, these on-ear cans do well in isolating the listener from aural distractions without the need for artificial noise cancellation. While I am by no means an audiophile suffice it to say it ain't hard to discern great sound. Buy 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Easton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Very natural sounding headphones! I purchased these more for the sound than anything else. The fact that they fold up and are very portable is a nice extra for me, but the low cost and high performance sound quality is why I made this purchase. Also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rushing

customer_reviews.title: KEF got it right the first time!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had HD 598 previously, which I liked a lot, but I must say these are much better. They are even more comfortable. The HD 598 are light weight and all but they cover my entire ear inside and with the sound stage coming from all directions it makes it a bit uneasy to listen for long period of time. But M500 seem to be excellent in all departments. I don't even know how it can get any better. Job well done KEF, I'm impressed. Please, buy them and find out for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Chummu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: After researching, testing and saving... I purchase the headphones. The sound quality if great. Base is not too much and I can hear all different types of music clearly.
customer_reviews.author: tmlsfo

customer_reviews.title: Delivered in used condition
customer_reviews.text: While the product itself is good, the box was open when arrived, and original packaging and includes were showing signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Aldoukhov

customer_reviews.title: This product was terrible. Ear pieces came unscrewed after 2 months of ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was terrible. Ear pieces came unscrewed after 2 months of very light use. Not worth $300, or even $100 for that matter. Poorly manufactured. To add insult to injury, serial number can only be found on the box, making it impossible to get warranty coverage if you don't hold onto the box.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Comfort is great and the sound quality is exactly what I exactly expected from KEF. I highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: DIGI

customer_reviews.title: Better Construction!!
customer_reviews.text: the headphones sound great but the construction of them is terrible. They are always falling off my ears/head. I've done everything to try to fix this and nothing works. Horrible
customer_reviews.author: Faustino

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Understand the Hype
customer_reviews.text: To me these are OK, but not remarkable, pandering to the popular masses of "midbass hump" listeners. The M500 offer basically a midrange-predominant sound with notable lower bass and upper treble roll-off. To my ears the Martin Logan Mikros 90 outperform the M500 in virtually every listening aspect (see my comparison on the Head-Fi website). It baffles me that a mid-fi/"pop"-voiced product like the KEF M500 can command a $250-$300 pricetag. The gullible [and apparently tin-eared] masses are getting exactly what they deserve, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: pataburd

customer_reviews.title: Ear pad design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I will only add here that the ear pads have fallen apart in a years time with average wear. I can only assume that this is why the replacement ear pads are out of stock wherever you look. My old Sony MDR-7506s had this same issue but then they didn't run me $300. Otherwise I have been very pleased with the sound quality and fit of this item.
customer_reviews.author: maxim

customer_reviews.title: KEF M500 Headphones
customer_reviews.text: KEF M500 - These headphones are the Rolls Royce of headphones without the RR price tag. Never before have I heard music so crisp and clear - close your eyes with these on and you are in the studio live with the artists. Fully recommend these to anyone who truly loves listening to their Music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Premium in every way
customer_reviews.text: There are headphones I own .... and then there are these. These are premium in every way. Normally, I struggle to hear the difference in sound quality. With these I know that there is a difference. The music is so `rich' and there is no seepage of external sound. The sound quality, build quality, case and attachments are superb. The headphones are light weight but sturdy and give the feel that they will last. The price is high, but for that you are getting a set of head phones that are quality. These are very difficult to fault..... and if you are 'serious about sound' (and have the money), they are well worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Warleybear

customer_reviews.title: Like listening to music for the first time. THAT good!
customer_reviews.text: These things are freaking awesome!!! Best sounding headphones I think I've ever had. Right now I'm listening to these with my LG V30 with a hi-fi DAC. The music on Spotify (highest quality stream) sounds unbelievable. I got these headphones for significantly less than the normal price - but they sound like headphones WORTH the normal price. Really, these are VERY good!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Graves

customer_reviews.title: No replacement cables
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure you have read all about how great these little headphones are. However, it looks like KEF stopped production on replacement cables. The 2 cables that came with the cans died in about a year of extensive use (each), and I couldn't find any 3rd party replacement cables that fit the narrow 2.5mm lead on the headphones. I contacted KEF directly and managed to buy 2 replacement cables for $20 a pop, but I don't think they will keep them for too long. Great product though, if you're willing to risk not being able to use the headphones with over-the-shelf cables (having to do a small project on resizing rubber leads) in a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Changseob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for really good on ears for a while. Love my Monster Miles Davis Trumpets. Have a couple pair of "low - end" Graco's (best under $100 headphones). Saw the KEF's in a stereo shop. I've had KEF's 104/2 reference speakers for 25 years. Still haven't heard anything better. The M500's sound great. I like jazz, Boz Scaggs, Steely Dan, classical, rock, acoustic guitar. These have tremendous definition, put you right in the middle. No leakage. My wife sat on couch and couldn't hear them. She put them on to hear CSN Helplessly Hoping and went "Wow!". As for the reviewer who said these were "unusable"...Really???
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: I never knew I could love headphones this much
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I could love headphones this much. I had a previous bias agains on-ear headphones but these aren't your average set. The cushions feel like I'm wearing pillows and the sound is crisp. The ear pieces actually form to your ears so as to isolate noise. I particularly like the bass that they can deliver. I recommend listening to any song off of 'Run the Jewels 2' to see what these guys can do. They came at a high price point but they're worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphone and better than Bowers & Wilkins P5
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Bowers & Wilkins P5 for years, and it's a good solid headphone. But until I listen with KEF M500, I found the what I heard in the past with Bowers & Wilkins P5, is not good quality of sound. The Bowers & Wilkins P5, the mid tone and treble are not clear and even fuzzy. But on the KEF M500 you can hear the details of the music, and the depth of the space. Buy the KEF M500, you will not be sorry to your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Eyewire

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice cans. They are extremely comfortable well built and they sound fantastic. Before I bought them I read reviews that stated that they weren't the type of headphones that would make you revisit your cd collection. That's true but I love these none the less. Well balanced with great bass. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Camino

customer_reviews.title: Good For About An Hour Per Listen
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps some of us just have fat heads :-) But the pressure builds up after about an hour and these beautiful headphones start hurting the ears... geeez--- I mean really uncomfortable... and I find myself moving them forward trying to relieve the pressure. If I make them larger, the pressure somewhat dissipates but they'll slip about. I also own the KEF M200 earbuds and while I really like the sounds from both KEF products, the M200s also have well-documented "fit" issues. So, KEF needs to address these issues and perhaps offer optional ear cushions for both products -- which would greatly enhance a pair of outstanding products.
customer_reviews.author: RLovell

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these earphones for a couple of months. I use them in the office every day while working, usually for 4+ hours. The office can be noisy sometimes but these headphones are excellent for sound isolation, which helps me to concentrate. They are well built, light and comfortable to wear. I don't have any other headphones to compare them against, but the sound is excellent. I have no regrets about buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Astie

customer_reviews.title: no regret !! best of the best
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headphone as open box but it was brand new with factory sealed! . I used this m500 with audinst mini(with opa2111) dac and what I can say is just wow! Every worth of penny. You should have a good hi-fi dac to use full power of m500. Sound stage is centered properly and above all, bass is awesome, tight and deep, clear. I seldom write reviews but I like to share how great this is. I had chance compare this with momentum and Marshall monitor,m500 is the most comfortable, balanced, neutral and clear bass. What can I say, just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: YEON HO SONG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones! They are great for use anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones! They are great for use anywhere, stylish and offers nice sound quality. Somewhat expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: chichi

customer_reviews.title: good sound - but so fragile
customer_reviews.text: Some screws just do not hold the ear pads got worn in no time (few months) It's unacceptable for headphones of this price
customer_reviews.author: xavier

customer_reviews.title: Bravo, KEF!
customer_reviews.text: Sound, comfort, design... Simply the best choise in this price range, no doubts. Will stay with me for years.
customer_reviews.author: zabada

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like my KEF reference speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have several KEF Reference Loudspeakers. I was stunted because the M500 sounded like KEF Loudspeakers and music separation was good.It was provided with carry case similar to a sunglass case.The headphone cord was detachable and I wish KEF could sell a Headphone cord with a shorter length say 60cm For iPhone users on the Go. Thank You KEF for producing a headphone that was never thought possible.
customer_reviews.author: Olympus OMD

customer_reviews.title: The cord breaks too easily and is difficult to replace because the shape of ...
customer_reviews.text: The cord breaks too easily and is difficult to replace because the shape of the headphone input is too narrow for other cords. Awful design
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Kef M500 Headphones Rock!
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound, Sleek Design and a super comfortable fit! Really a well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Sheppard

product_meta.title: KEF M500 Hi-Fi Headphones w/Mic & Remote - Aluminum/Black
product_meta.description: KEFs 40mm neodymium driver in the M500 is tuned to deliver full range high definition response from 20Hz to 20kHz. Each aperture in the tuning plate mounted over the driver in the acoustic chamber is precisely positioned to optimise clarity, dynamics and bass weighting. The sturdy lightweight frame securely locates each ear cup in exactly the right position. Memory foam in the breathable ear pads automatically moulds itself to the shape of your ear.
feature_bullets: The aluminum frame conforms to the shape of your head, giving a perfect fit every time.

Featuring an integrated in-line microphone and remote control for the iPhone and other Apple products on the tangle-free flat cable, the M500 allows you to easily operate the play functions or switch between calls and music.
An acoustic sealing ring in each racetrack ear cup provides an excellent seal that cuts out extraneous noise and minimises sound leakage.
KEF headphones are designed to comply with the CENELEC standard EN60065/A12 for protection against excessive sound pressure.
The frame folds up neatly afterwards, allowing you to pack your headphones in the hard-shell carrying case for maximum protection when not in use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars131 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
